full_summary:
## Solicitation for Programmer/Analyst Services
### Notice ID: PW-22-01005284

The National Research Council Canada (NRC) is soliciting bids for the provision of Programmer/Analyst services for the Industrial Research Assistance Program (NRC IRAP).

## Background
NRC IRAP requires the services of one (1) Level 2 Programmer/Analyst to support its operations.

## Scope of Work
The selected service provider will be required to perform the following tasks:

* Provide technical support and programming services to NRC IRAP;
* Develop, test, and implement software solutions;
* Analyze and troubleshoot software-related issues.

## Contract Details
### Contract Type: Service Contract
#### Contract Value: To be determined
#### Contract Duration: To be determined

## Evaluation Criteria
The bids will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical expertise and qualifications;
* Past experience in similar projects;
* Bidder's proposed approach and methodology;
* Schedule and budget.

## Tender Requirements
### Tender Documents
The tender documents, including the solicitation documents and attachments, are available on the Buy and Sell platform at [the provided links](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/08/24/8511bc9b168a42e3f6ccb220feef2f92/22-58047_apn_programmeur_analyste.pdf,https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/08/24/0d38c9add30cc49260374a3ed9687d95/22-58047_npp_programmer_analyst.pdf).

### Closing Date
The tender closing date is September 12, 2022, at 14:00 (EST).

### Contact Information
For more information, please contact Roxanne AzziAbboud, Procurement Officer, at (613) 299-9650 or [roxanne.azziabboud@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:roxanne.azziabboud@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca).

### Notice Type: Request for Proposal

### Procurement Method: Competitive - Selective Tendering

Please note that this request for proposal is subject to the terms and conditions outlined in the solicitation documents. Bidders are responsible for ensuring that they meet the eligibility and qualifications criteria outlined in the request for proposal. The NRC reserves the right to reject any bid that fails to meet the requirements outlined
